attributes.title: Tropicana Orange Juice - Mapping Assignment
attributes.description: This mapping assignment looks beyond a simple glass of orange juice and examines all of the steps and places that one orange must travel to arrive into ones glass.
From Zehrs Grocers, I buy my carton of Tropicana Orange juice and pour myself a glass, and enjoy.  Every glass I pour intrigues me that so much hard work and enthusiasm goes into every glass.
attributes.address: 275 Nottawasaga Street, Orillia, ON L3V 6A8, Canada
attributes.title: My Glass of Orange Juice

attributes.description: The Orange juice is shipped from Toronto all over Ontario.  For the purposes of this assignment, I will use Zehrs Grocers as an example where I buy my Tropicana Orange Juice from.
attributes.address: 289 Coldwater Road West, Orillia, ON L3V, Canada
attributes.title: Zehrs Groceries

attributes.description: Tropicana is owned by Pepsico (Pepsi).  From New Jersey, the packaged orange juice is shipped to Toronto, and held at the refrigerated storage facilities before being shipped off to manufacturers.
attributes.address: Pepsico, 5205 Satellite Drive, Mississauga, ON L4W 5P9, Canada
attributes.title: Pepsico

attributes.description: Once the Juice Train drops off all of the oranges in New Jersey, a rinsing and washing stage is first completed.  After all of the oranges are clean, an extraction process occurs.  The oranges are peeled and the oils are taken out.  Once this process has occurred, the juices are sucked out and sent to a specialized machine that takes out the pulp and seeds.  After this process occurs, the orange juice is now ready to be put into a carton and shipped off to retailers around the world by air, ground travel, and through waterways.  Packaging the orange juice is all done at the same factory, and some of the orange juice is frozen into Tropicana freezer packs.
attributes.address: 9 Linden Avenue East, Jersey City, NJ 07305, USA
attributes.title: Tropicana Manufacturing

attributes.description: In Florida, Orange trees blossom October through June in the fields.  95% of the oranges are picked by hand using a ladder and a sack.  Once the oranges are picked, they are put into a truck which brings the oranges to the main Tropicana Production factory in Bradenton, Florida.  Here, each orange is inspected individually to ensure it is adequate enough to use in making the orange juice.  At this factory, the oranges go through a minimum maturity checklist and are scanned to ensure the orange is okay to give to the public.  Currently Tropicana only utilizes 12 orange groves in Florida.
attributes.title: Tropicana Factory

attributes.description: Once all of the oranges are inspected at Bradenton, Florida, they are shipped by train through many different states until they reach there final destination in New Jersey.  The train that brings the oranges to New Jersey is known as the 'juice train' and runs the track three times a week carrying anywhere from 3000 - 6000 lbs of oranges at any given time.  Attached is a video of the juice train pulling thousands of pounds of tropicana oranges to New Jersey
attributes.title: Tropicana Factory to Tropicana Manufacturing
Tropicana Manufacturing to Pepsico
attributes.description: Tractor Trailers deliver the packaged orange juice from New Jersey to Toronto, ON where the orange juice is held before distribution.

attributes.title: Zehrs Groceries to My Glass of Orange Juice
